text: Casey Dellacqua was the defending champion, however she chose not to participate. Eri Hozumi won the title, defeating Risa Ozaki in an all-Japanese final, 7–6(7–5), 5–7, 6–2. == Seeds == == Main draw == === Finals === === Top half === === Bottom half === == References == * Main draw Bendigo Women's International (1) - Singles
title: 2014 Bendigo Women's International (1) – Singles
